newsitem.title: USA: Spyglass sees possible first half '97 loss.
newsitem.headline: Spyglass sees possible first half '97 loss.

text.p: Spyglass Inc said Wednesday a significant increase in research and development spending could lead to a loss of a few cents per share in the first half of its fiscal year 1997.

"Potentially in the first half we could see us losing a few pennies per share," said Gary Vilchick, chief financial officer, in a conference call with industry analysts. "In second half we could see profitability returning."
Vilchick said the company expects to report a profit for the full fiscal 1997 and revenue growth in the 50-percent range.

Earlier, Spyglass reported a profit of $0.08 a share for the fourth quarter ended September 30 versus $0.09 last year. Excluding a one-time gain in its 1995 fourth quarter, earnings per share for the quarter rose by $0.03 a share, the company said.
For the full fiscal year, earnings rose to $0.27 a share compared with $0.21.
Spyglass said it has undertaken an aggressive plan to expand in the Internet device market. The company, said it would double the size of its research and development team, among other things.

Spyglass said it will provide software and services to make industrial and consumer devices, such as cellular phones, televisions and set-top boxes and manufacturing equipment, work with the Internet.
"We are very serious about winning in this device marketplace," said Doug Colbeth, chief executive of Spyglass.
